decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): 02 (existing drawings), 05 (proposed drawings), Planning Statement prepared by Bhox.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development in a secure compound. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification) the premises shall only be used as a children's residential home for one (1) child aged 8-18 and for no other purpose (including any other use falling within Class C2 of the Order, but may revert back to C3 (dwelling house) on cessation of the use).

Reason:  To ensure the development would not harm the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policy 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The hereby approved residential care home shall be registered and operate under an Ofsted registration. All placements at the home shall be appropriately matched by age.
Reason: To protect and safeguard the future residents in accordance with policy S3 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Change of use from single dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to residential care home (Use Class C2) for children with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities ('SEND') or Learning Difficulties ('LD') or Emotional and Behavioural Difficulties ('EBD') and associated alterations
